result.execSummary:
The defendant Stephen P Corbin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property >$5000-$10,000, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

02:28 PM Defendant Stephen P Corbin appeared by video means. Prosecuting Atty Brian J. Juech appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.
Court questions defendant on his request.  Defendant states his request for sentence modification.  Atty Juech objects to any modification.  
BY THE COURT:  Court does not believe the request shows a new factor and Court will deny the request.

Defendant Stephen P Corbin in court with attorney Mark J Gumz.  Defendant Stephen P Corbin in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that all parties have received a copy of the revocation packet.  Court questions the defense.  Atty Gumz states that they have received a copy of the revocation summary and have no changes.

Atty Hendee makes sentencing recommendations.
Atty Gumz makes sentencing arguments and asks the court to accept the joint recommendation.
Defendant makes a statement to the court.

BY THE COURT:  Court orders 3 years 9 months in the Wisconsin State Prison System with 1 year 3 months Initial Confinement and 2 years 6 months Extended Supervision with conditions; consecutive to any other sentence
Defendant is remanded into custody
Credit = 111 days
Restitution, fine and costs to be paid while on ES

to Court from Atty Gumz-request JOC amended to allow for jail transfer.  Approved BNB/3-21-18

Defendant Stephen P Corbin in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Defendant Stephen P Corbin in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Atty Hendee states plea agreement.  Atty Gumz agrees and requests huber.  Court questions the defendant.  Defendant agrees and enters a No Contest plea.
  Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Court finds plea made freely, voluntarily & Intelligently.  Court relies on the criminal complaint for a factual basis.  

BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty.

  State has complied with victim notification requirements and files a victim impact statement with the court and the defense.
Atty Hendee makes sentencing recommendations and asks the court to follow the joint recommendation.
Atty Gumz makes sentencing arguments.  Atty Gumz is not requesting a PSI.  Atty Hendee is not requesting a PSI.
Defendant makes a statement to the court.

BY THE COURT:  Withhold Sentence; 36 months Probation with conditions:
*1 year in the Marquette County Jail w/huber
  Defendant is remanded into custody
*Credit = to be determined by counsel at a later date
*May transfer to Columbia County
*Court Costs = $268.00
*DNA Sample + $250.00 Surcharge
*Comply with and complete any and all counseling or treatment recommended by the Agent
*Restitution = $5,879.88 + 587.98 surcharge = $6,467.86 (to be paid while on probation)

  If probation is discharged/revoked with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due and/or other collection procedures will be implemented. If revoked and sent to prison, DOC shall withhold 25% of all inmate monies to pay fines/costs/surcharges/restitution with the balance due as a condition of extended supervision/parole.

  **Court advises defendant that they have been convicted of a Felony and advises rights of voting privileges and of owning a firearm.
